name: Laos
introduction: Modern-day Laos has its roots in the ancient Lao kingdom of Lan Xang established in the 14th century under King FA NGUM. For 300 years Lan Xang had influence reaching into present-day Cambodia and Thailand as well as over all of what is now Laos. After centuries of gradual decline Laos came under the domination of Siam (Thailand) from the late 18th century until the late 19th century when it became part of French Indochina. The Franco-Siamese Treaty of 1907 defined the current Lao border with Thailand. In 1975 the communist Pathet Lao took control of the government ending a six-century-old monarchy and instituting a strict socialist regime closely aligned to Vietnam. A gradual limited return to private enterprise and the liberalization of foreign investment laws began in 1988. Laos became a member of ASEAN in 1997 and the WTO in 2013.
overview: Laos is a Southeast Asian country traversed by the Mekong River and known for mountainous terrain French colonial architecture hill tribe settlements and Buddhist monasteries. Vientiane the capital is the site of the That Luang monument where a reliquary reportedly houses the Buddha’s breastbone plus the Patuxai war memorial and Talat Sao (Morning Market) a complex jammed with food clothes and craft stalls.

languages.name: Arem
languages.area: Quang Binh Province, Bo Trach District, Tan Trach, 1 or 2 families of Thuong Trach. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Akeu
languages.area: South Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Prefecture, most villages in Jinhong County, some in Mengla County. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand.

languages.name: Akha
languages.area: Shan state, east Kengtung District. Also in China, Laos, Thailand, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Alak
languages.area: South, mainly Saravan and Sekong provinces.

languages.name: Bit
languages.area: Near the north border with China, northeast of Namtha, Luand Namtha Province, and south of Boun Neua; Phongsali Province, Boun-Tai, Samphan, and Khoa districts, 8 villages. Also in China.

languages.name: Bo (Laos)
languages.area: Central, inland from the Mekong River bend, Nhang River, Nape area; Kammouan, Lak Sao, Bolikhamxay provinces, Hinboun District.

languages.name: Tai Dam
languages.area: North, along Red and Black rivers; now settled south in Tung Nghia (Lam Dam), Tho Thanh (Dac Lac), Pleiku (Gia Lai), elsewhere. Also in Australia, China, France, Laos, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Lave
languages.area: Attopeu Province, Laos-Cambodia border. Also in Cambodia, France, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Eastern Bru
languages.area: East Savannehkhet Province, Sepone District. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Western Bru
languages.area: Mukdahan Province, Dong Luang District. Also in United States.

languages.name: Western Cham
languages.area: Near major cities and along the Mekong. Also in Australia, France, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Saudi Arabia, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam, Yemen.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Con
languages.area: Luang Namtha Province, southwest of Vieng Pou Kha.

languages.name: Chuanqiandian Cluster Miao
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: West Guizhou, west Guangxi, south Sichuan, Yunnan (especially southeast and northeast).

languages.name: Halang
languages.area: Kon Tum Province. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Halang Doan
languages.area: Kon Tum Province, between the Sedang [sed] and the Cua [cua]. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Hani
languages.area: South Yunnan, Jingdong and Jinggu counties, Yuanjiang and Lancang (Mekong) river basins, Ailao Mountains. Also in Laos, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Hmong Njua
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: North. Also in Australia, Canada, China, France, French Guiana, Myanmar, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Hung
languages.area: Bolikhamsay, Khammouan provinces. Toum dialect northeast of Nape and south of the Phong. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Honi
languages.area: South Yunnan Province, east Simao Prefecture, Mojiang Hani, Pu’er Hani, Yi, and Dai autonomous counties; Yuxi Municipal Prefecture, Yuanjiang Hani, and Yi and Dai autonomous counties.

languages.name: Ir
languages.area: Saravan Province, east of Saravan town.

languages.name: Iu Mien
languages.area: Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, Dayao Mountains, Guangdong in Ruyuan County, Yunnan, Hunan provinces; Guizhou Province, Rongjiang, Congjiang, and Libo counties. Also in Belgium, Denmark, France, Laos, Myanmar, New Zealand, Switzerland, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Jeh
languages.area: Kon Tum, Quang Nam provinces. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Kuy
languages.area: East central, Buriram, Surin, Sisaket, Ubon, Roi Et provinces. Also in Cambodia, Laos.

languages.name: Lü
languages.area: South Yunnan, Jinghong (Chiang Hung, Chien Rung), Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, west of Lixianjiang (Black) River. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Khuen
languages.area: Luang Namtha Province, Nale, Sing, and Viangphoukha districts. Near Lamet [lbn]. Also in China, United States.

languages.name: Khmer
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Canada, China, France, Laos, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Khmu
languages.area: Scattered in north. Also in China, France, Myanmar, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Khün
languages.area: Main Kentung Valley in the center of Shan state. Also in Thailand.

languages.name: Kaduo
languages.area: Yunnan Province, primarily southeast Simao Prefecture, Pu’er, Mojiang, and Jiangcheng counties. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Western Katu
languages.area: Sekong, Saravan, Champassak provinces, Upper Xe Kong River, high basin of Song Boung River watershed along the border.

languages.name: Kang
languages.area: Houaphan Province, Xam-Tai District; Xiangkhoang Province, Nonghet District. Also in China.

languages.name: Lao
languages.area: Mekong River Valley, Luang Prabang south to Cambodia border. Lao-Khrang in Nakhonsawan and Nakhon Pathom area. Possibly in Viet Nam. Also in Australia, Cambodia, Canada, France, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Rmeet
languages.area: Northwest, Luang Namtha, Bokeo provinces. Also in Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Laven
languages.area: Southwest, Champassak, Attopeu provinces, Boloven Plateau, near the Alak [alk]. Also in United States.

languages.name: Lahu Shi
languages.area: South Yunnan Province, Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, Menghai District, Menghai County (Menghai Township); Simao Prefecture, Lancang Lahu Autonomous County, Nuofu District, other areas. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Lahu
languages.area: Southwest Yunnan Province, Simao Prefecture, Lancang Lahu, Menglian Dai, Lahu & Va autonomous counties; Lincang Prefecture, Gengma Dai, Va autonomous counties. Also in Laos, Myanmar, Thailand, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Kim Mun
languages.area: Yunnan Province, seventeen counties; Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, thirteen counties; Hainan Province, 7 counties. Also in Laos, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Mal
languages.area: Xaignabouli Province, Phiang District, west of Mekong River. Also in Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Mlabri
languages.area: Phayao, Nan, Phrae, Utaradit, Phitsanuloke, Loey, perhaps other provinces. Laos border area. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Muong
languages.area: Mostly north central mountains, Hoa Bình, Thanh Hóa, Vinh Phú, Yen Bai, Son La, Ninh Binh provinces.

languages.name: Hmong Daw
languages.autonym: lus Hmoob / lug Moob / lol Hmongb
languages.area: South and southwest Guizhou, northwest Guangxi, southeast and southwest Yunnan. Also in France, Laos, Thailand, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Burmese
languages.area: South, central, and adjacent areas. Also in Bangladesh, Malaysia (Peninsular), Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Min Nan Chinese
languages.area: South Fujian, Guangdong, south Hainan Island, south Zhejiang, south Jiangxi provinces. Xiamen in south Fujian, Jiangxi, and Taiwan; Hainan in Hainan; Leizhou on Leizhou peninsula of southwest Guangdong; Chao-Shan in far east corner of Guangdong in Chaozhou-Shantou area; Longdu is a dialect island around Zhongshan City and Shaxi in Guangdong south of Guangzhou; Zhenan Min in southeast Zhejiang Province around Pingyang and Cangnan and on Zhoushan archipelago of northeast Zhejiang. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Kriang
languages.area: South, Sekong, Saravan, Champassak provinces. 25 villages.

languages.name: Northern Thai
languages.area: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Lamphun, Lampang, Maehongson, Hot, Nan, Phayao, Phrae, Uttaradit, Tak provinces. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Eastern Nisu
languages.area: Yunnan, Jianshui, Tonghai, Gejiu, Kaiyuan, Mengzi, Pingbian, Hekou counties.

languages.name: Nguôn
languages.area: 11 villages: Kwi-dat, An Duk, Ba nuong, Than long, Tan kieu; Ko liem, Bok tho (An tho), Kim bang, Tan li, An lak.

languages.name: Nung (Viet Nam)
languages.area: Mainly Cao Bang, Lang Son provinces; also now in Ho Chi Minh City, Dong Nai, Lam Dong, and Dac Lac. Also in Australia, Canada, Laos, United States.

languages.name: Nyaw
languages.area: Sakorn Nakorn, Ta Bo’, Nong Khai; Tha Uthen, Nakorn Panom.

languages.name: Ong
languages.area: Saravan Province, north of Saravan town.

languages.name: Oy
languages.area: Attopeu Province, at the foot of Bolaven Plateau near Pakse.

languages.name: Pacoh
languages.area: Quang Tri Province. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Bouyei
languages.area: Guizhou-Yunnan plateau, mainly Buyi-Miao and Miao-Dong autonomous prefectures, Zhenning and Guanling counties, south and southwest Guizhou; Yunnan Province, Luoping County; Sichuan Province, Ningnan and Huidong counties. Also in France, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Phunoi
languages.area: North central, Phony Saly area. Also in Thailand.

languages.name: Phana'
languages.area: Luang Namtha Province and District, Bopiet and Namtoung villages; Bokeo Province, Houayxay District, one village.

languages.name: Phuan
languages.area: Uthai Thani, Phichit, Petchabun, Lopburi, Singburi, Suphanburi, Saraburi, Nakorn Nayok, Phrachinburi, Udon, Loei; 1 village south of Bangkok. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Maleng
languages.area: Khammouan Province, Nakay District, Nam Theun Valley, near Theun River banks. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Phong-Kniang
languages.area: South Houaphan Province, Viangthong and Houamuang districts, near Neun River; north Xieng Khouang Province.

languages.name: Phai
languages.area: North, Nan Province, Thung Chang, Chalerm Prakiat, Chiang Klang, Bo Klua, Pua districts. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Puoc
languages.area: North, Lai Chau, Son La provinces, Laos border area. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Chut
languages.area: Quang Binh Province, Thuong Hoa, Hoa Son, Dan Hoa communes, near the Laos border at the same latitude as Mu Gia Pass. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Sedang
languages.area: Kon Tum, Quang Nam, Quang Ngai provinces. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Saek
languages.area: Central, near Viet Nam border; Khammouan Province, Upper Nam Noy and Nam Pheo areas; Borikhamxay Province, Khamkeut District, Na Kadok village. Also in Thailand.

languages.name: Sila
languages.area: North central, north of Muong Hai. Also in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Sapuan
languages.area: South, Attopeu Province, Se Kong and Se Kamane rivers’ banks.

languages.name: Sou
languages.area: South, Attopeu Province, Phouvong and Sanamxai districts.

languages.name: Sô
languages.area: Khammouan, Thakhek, Savannakhet provinces, both sides of Mekong River. Also in Thailand.

languages.name: Samtao
languages.area: East Shan state. Also in China, Laos, Thailand.

languages.name: Tai Nüa
languages.area: South central Yunnan, Dehong Prefecture, southwest of Dali near Lancang (Mekong) River. May be in north Viet Nam. Also in France, Laos, Myanmar, Switzerland, Thailand.

languages.name: Talieng
languages.area: Savannakhet Province, Muong Phine-Bung Sai area.

languages.name: Tareng
languages.area: West of Viet Nam border, east of Kayong, north of Chavane and Thia.

languages.name: Thai
languages.area: Central, centered in Bangkok. Khorat in Ratchasima. Also in Canada, Singapore, United Arab Emirates, United States.

languages.name: Aheu
languages.area: Thavung in Sakon Nakhon Province, Song Daw District, 3 villages; Phon Soung live about 100 km south of the Thavung. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Tai Loi
languages.area: Eastern Shan state, Northern Mong Yawng Township and across the border into China, Doi is across the border in Laos. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Tay Khang
languages.area: Khammouan Province. Possibly in Viet Nam.

languages.name: Tai Pao
languages.area: Bolikhamxay Province, Viangthong, Khamkeut, Pakkading districts.

languages.name: Upper Ta'oih
languages.area: Saravan Province, Ta-Oy District. Also in United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Lower Ta'oih
languages.area: Saravan Province, northwest of Saravan town.

languages.name: Northeastern Thai
languages.area: Northeast; 17 provinces. Kalerng in Sakon Nakhon and Nakhon Phanom.

languages.name: Tai Dón
languages.area: Northern Vietnam, along the Red and Black rivers; south now settled mainly in Tung Nghia (Lam Dong Province). Also in China, France, Laos.

languages.name: O'du
languages.area: North, Nghe Tinh Province. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Tai Do
languages.area: North.

languages.name: Tai Daeng
languages.area: North central, Thanh Hoa Province, south of Sam Nuea. Also in Laos, Thailand, United States.

languages.name: Kuan
languages.area: Bolikhamxay Province, Viangthong District, near Mouan River.

languages.name: Vietnamese
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Australia, Cambodia, Canada, China, Côte d’Ivoire, Czech Republic, Finland, France, Germany, Laos, Martinique, Netherlands, New Caledonia, Norway, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Senegal, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Vanuatu.

languages.name: Khua
languages.area: West central; southeast of Giap Tam. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Kiorr
languages.area: Louang Nam Tha, Bokeo provinces. 6 villages. Also in Myanmar.

languages.name: Chepya
languages.area: Southern Yunnan Province. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Yoy
languages.area: Sakorn Nakorn. Also in Laos.

languages.name: Yue Chinese
languages.area: Guangdong (except Hakka speaking areas northeast, Min Nan-speaking areas east, Hainan Island); Guangxi. Hong Kong and Macau. Also in Australia, Brunei, Canada, Costa Rica, Honduras, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Nauru, Netherlands, New Zealand, Panama, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam.
